channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HADOOP-16018] DistCp won't reassemble chunks when blocks per chunk > 0
item.description:
I was investigating why hadoop-distcp-2.9.2 won't reassemble chunks of the same file when blocks per chunk has been set > 0.

In the CopyCommitter::commitJob, this logic can prevent chunks from reassembling if blocks per chunk is equal to 0:

if (blocksPerChunk > 0) {
  concatFileChunks(conf);
}

Then in CopyCommitter's ctor, blocksPerChunk is initialised from the config:

blocksPerChunk = context.getConfiguration().getInt(
DistCpOptionSwitch.BLOCKS_PER_CHUNK.getConfigLabel(), 0);

 

But here the config key DistCpOptionSwitch.BLOCKS_PER_CHUNK.getConfigLabel() will always returns empty string because it is constructed without config label:

BLOCKS_PER_CHUNK("",
new Option("blocksperchunk", true, "If set to a positive value, files"
+ "with more blocks than this value will be split into chunks of "
+ "<blocksperchunk> blocks to be transferred in parallel, and "
+ "reassembled on the destination. By default, <blocksperchunk> is "
+ "0 and the files will be transmitted in their entirety without "
+ "splitting. This switch is only applicable when the source file "
+ "system implements getBlockLocations method and the target file "
+ "system implements concat method"))

As a result it will fall back to the default value 0 for blocksPerChunk, and prevent the chunks from reassembling.
item.summary: DistCp won't reassemble chunks when blocks per chunk > 0

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment: I'm trying to contribute a simple fix for this issue
its test can pass, because the empty config key is not overridden in the UT

I opened a PR with the fix here:

https://github.com/apache/hadoop/pull/451

Github user kai33 closed the pull request at:

https://github.com/apache/hadoop/pull/450

GitHub user kai33 opened a pull request:

https://github.com/apache/hadoop/pull/451

HADOOP-16018: Fix DistCp not reassemble chunks when blocks per chunk > 0

You can merge this pull request into a Git repository by running:

$ git pull https://github.com/kai33/hadoop HADOOP-16018

Alternatively you can review and apply these changes as the patch at:

https://github.com/apache/hadoop/pull/451.patch

To close this pull request, make a commit to your master/trunk branch
with (at least) the following in the commit message:

This closes #451

commit 739a1548261e64d333fc42ae58b0ed3021e4c5b7
Author: Kai33 <gigikie@...>
Date: 2018-12-20T16:19:28Z

Fix DistCp not reassemble chunks when blocks per chunk > 0

Hi Kai X, thanks for reporting the issue.
Was this broken by HADOOP-15850? yuzhihong@gmail.com FYI
Looking at https://github.com/apache/hadoop/commits/trunk/hadoop-tools/hadoop-distcp/src/main/java/org/apache/hadoop/tools/DistCpOptionSwitch.java , it was not touched by HADOOP-15850

I can observe `BLOCKS_PER_CHUNK.getConfigLabel()` is used for the first time in HADOOP-15850 and then hits this regression.

 

Also verified these in my cluster

  • hadoop-distcp-2.9.1 can reassemble chunks (can be used as a workaround)
  • 2.9.2 cannot, debug log in CopyCommitter ctor always prints "blocks per chunk 0"
  • 2.9.2 with the patch applied can reassemble chunks, debug log can print the correct value for blocks per chunk.
Uploaded the patch from the PR to trigger pre-commit job

Hi stevel@apache.org

It seems the patch is merged with HADOOP-14556's commit somehow, is it normal?

yeah, just noticed that myself. Not intentional. I'd somehow managed to merge in the large patch atop your one, which I'd applied, before committing. I think I'd forgotten that I'd not completed this merge and didn't check for things being clean in my commit-only-source tree. All my fault...I think was overexcited at getting a big piece of work in

I'm going to do a patch to revert that bit of HADOOP-14556 and reapply this one separately.
Patch is merged into the 3.x branches; submitted the branch-2 patch to see that jenkins is happy there
Good catch, Kai! Thanks for offering the patch. Sorry I was late to this. Patch looks good to me too.

stevel@apache.org it's fine  no apologies needed. Thanks for merging the patch!

weichiu thanks for reviewing the patch

SUCCESS: Integrated in Jenkins build Hadoop-trunk-Commit #15744 (See https://builds.apache.org/job/Hadoop-trunk-Commit/15744/)

This message was automatically generated.
branch-2's DistCpOptions doesn't have builder, fix it in the branch-2-003 patch

after fixing the compilation issue in branch-2-003 patch, jenkins starts to hang during the unit test of distcp.

from jenkins' unit test log it said

[WARNING] Corrupted STDOUT by directly writing to native stream in forked JVM 1. See FAQ web page and the dump file /testptch/hadoop/hadoop-tools/hadoop-distcp/target/surefire-reports/2019-01-09T03-06-03_867-jvmRun1.dumpstream
...
[INFO] Running org.apache.hadoop.tools.TestDistCpSync
(hanging)

which may be the hanging cause and seems unrelated to the patch

 

I ran it locally and all test can be passed.

If it didn't happen before the patch, and it happens now, I'm not sure that it can be tagged as unrelated. But it could just be this is the first patch to go near tools/distcp for a while

How about you attach a branch-2 patch here which does nothing but some harmess diff to a documentation page or something, which will be enough to get it tested? That'll help isolate it -if that is the problem then we'll have to see what's up with jenkins. If, on the other hand, it only happens with this patch, then something is up here (very unlikely considering)
Good idea! submitted branch-2-004 patch that only adds in a string constant without any usage.

Hi stevel@apache.org 

tried the way you mentioned and I understand it should be working, but jenkins consistently fails to build docker image for branch-2 due to npm error:

npm ERR! 
npm ERR! Additional logging details can be found in:
npm ERR!     /root/npm-debug.log
npm ERR! not ok code 0
[0mThe command '/bin/sh -c apt-get -y install nodejs &&     ln -s /usr/bin/nodejs /usr/bin/node &&     apt-get -y install npm &&     npm config set strict-ssl false &&     npm install -g bower &&     npm install -g ember-cli' returned a non-zero code: 1

when I removed the line above in Dockerfile, jenkins can proceed but it will run the whole set of unit test ... and failed. Do you have any suggestion to proceed? Thanks

I just did a local build with the "-Pyarn-ui" and it took, and just ran the npm -install commands locally so it's not that the bower and ember-cli packages don't exist. At the same time, 

npm http GET https://registry.npmjs.org/babel/plugin-transform-modules-amd

...
npm http 405 https://registry.npmjs.org/babel/plugin-transform-modules-amd
npm http GET https://registry.npmjs.org/watch-detector/-/watch-detector-0.1.0.tgz
npm ERR! TypeError: Cannot read property 'latest' of undefined
npm ERR!     at next (/usr/share/npm/lib/cache.js:687:35)
npm ERR!     at /usr/share/npm/lib/cache.js:675:5
npm ERR!     at saved (/usr/share/npm/node_modules/npm-registry-client/lib/get.js:142:7)
npm ERR!     at /usr/lib/nodejs/graceful-fs/polyfills.js:133:7
npm ERR!     at Object.oncomplete (fs.js:107:15)
npm ERR! If you need help, you may report this log at:
npm ERR!     <http://github.com/isaacs/npm/issues>
npm ERR! or email it to:
npm ERR!     <npm-@googlegroups.com>
npm ERR! System Linux 4.4.0-138-generic
npm ERR! command "/usr/bin/nodejs" "/usr/bin/npm" "install" "-g" "ember-cli"
npm ERR! cwd /root
npm ERR! node -v v0.10.25
npm ERR! npm -v 1.3.10
npm ERR! type non_object_property_load

Trying a HEAD on the URL (or a GET) fails with method not allowed

>  curl -I https://registry.npmjs.org/babel/plugin-transform-modules-amd
HTTP/2 405 
..

I'm at my limit of understanding of "npm", whose purpose is to show that every tool invents a packaging system and while some are good (tex, python), some aren't.

Any suggestions by ~aw?

The nodejs stuff is just awful and has been mostly unnecessary for a while now. Another one of those moments where I was told to basically go away on common-dev when it was introduced. Anyway, probably start with HADOOP-15617 . If Hadoop adds the jshint package, they'll get javascript linting in yetus 0.9.0. (e.g., https://github.com/apache/yetus/blob/269ed7f4b89cdf50ee152fe2e7aa1eb805c964f0/precommit/src/main/shell/test-patch-docker/Dockerfile#L221)

The nodejs stuff is just awful and has been mostly unnecessary for a while now.

hmm

if that is cut all will be well?

Thanks for resolving the image building issue on branch-2!
